mcc.description: The merchant category code for the account. MCCs are used to classify businesses based on the goods or services they provide.

description.description: Internal-only description of the product sold by, or service provided by, the business. Used by BIOS for risk and underwriting purposes.

company.description: Information about the company or business.

persons.description: Information about the persons attached to this sellers.

bank_accounts.description: Information about the bank accounts attached to this sellers.

seller_id.description: ID of the seller associated with this company.

phone.description: The company’s phone number (used for verification).

structure.description: The category identifying the legal structure of the company or legal entity.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

line1.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

MetadataContract.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

seller_id.description: ID of the seller associated with this bank account.

nationality.description: The country where the person is a national.

day.description: The day of birth, between 1 and 31.

month.description: The month of birth, between 1 and 12.

seller_id.description: ID of the seller associated with this bank account.

country.description: Two-letter ISO code representing the country the bank account is located in.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO code for the currency paid out to the bank account.

holder_name.description: The name of the person or business that owns the bank account.

holder_type.description: The type of entity that holds the account.

country.description: The country in which the seller holder resides, or in which the business is legally established. This should be an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. For example, if you are in the United States and the business for which you’re creating an account is legally represented in Canada, you would use CA as the country for the account being created.

mcc.description: The merchant category code for the account. MCCs are used to classify businesses based on the goods or services they provide.

description.description: Internal-only description of the product sold by, or service provided by, the business. Used by BIOS for risk and underwriting purposes.

company.description: Information about the company or business.

persons.description: Information about the person to attach to this sellers.

bank_accounts.description: Bank accounts to attach to the seller for receiving payouts

phone.description: The company’s phone number(used for verification).

structure.description: The category identifying the legal structure of the company or legal entity.

city.description: City, district, suburb, town, or village.

line1.description: Address line 1 (e.g., street, PO Box, or company name).

line2.description: Address line 2 (e.g., apartment, suite, unit, or building).

MetadataOptions.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Individual keys can be unset by posting an empty value to them. All keys can be unset by posting an empty value to metadata.

nationality.description: The country where the person is a national.

day.description: The day of birth, between 1 and 31.

month.description: The month of birth, between 1 and 12.

country.description: The country in which the bank account is located.

currency.description: The currency the bank account is in. This must be a country/currency pairing that BIOS supports.

account_number.description: The account number for the bank account, in string form. Must be a checking account.

holder_name.description: The name of the person or business that owns the bank account.

holder_type.description: The type of entity that holds the account. This can be either individual or company.

EmptyResponse.description: a response dto that doesn't have any properties

seller_id.description: The Seller ID that this person belongs to.
The Seller ID that this company belongs to.
The Seller ID that this bank belongs to.
